0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Otitis externa, acute, Caused by susceptible strains of Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus: 4 drops into affected ear(s) twice daily for 7 days
  • Otitis externa, acute, Caused by susceptible strains of Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus: With otowick: 8 drops into affected ear(s) for first dose, followed by 4 drops twice daily for 7 days

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Otitis externa, acute, Caused by susceptible strains of Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus: (1 year or older): 4 drops into affected ear(s) twice daily for 7 days
  • Otitis externa, acute, Caused by susceptible strains of Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus: (1 year or older) with otowick: 8 drops into affected ear(s) for first dose, followed by 4 drops twice daily for 7 days

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Otitis externa, acute, Caused by susceptible strains of Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: Specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Immunologic:
  • -- Allergic reaction may occur, especially in patients with a history of hypersensitivity to finafloxacin, other quinolones, or any component of the product; discontinue use if suspected and initiate alternative therapy
  • -- Overgrowth of nonsusceptible organisms (eg, yeast and fungi) may occur with prolonged use; discontinue use if suspected and initiate alternative therapy

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Nausea (1%)
  • Otic:Pruritus, Of the ear (1%)
Serious
Immunologic:Allergic reaction, Infection due to resistant organism

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Finafloxacin, a fluoroquinolone antibiotic, inhibits bacterial type 2 topoisomerase enzymes, DNA gyrase, and topoisomerase IV, which are necessary for bacterial DNA replication, transcription, repair, and recombination.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Otic
  • Warm bottle by hand for 1 to 2 minutes prior to administration
  • Shake well before use

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: Reduction in the symptoms of acute otitis externa may indicate efficacy.

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Side effects may include pruritus of the ear or nausea.
  • Advise patient to immediately report allergic reaction.
  • Instruct patient to warm solution in their hands for at least 1 to 2 minutes before administration to ear.
  • Counsel patient on appropriate dosing and instillation techniques.
